Dear Chad Sharpe:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on . Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan is
required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must
include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at.
Sincerely,

Venus M. Decker
Child Welfare Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
COF Rule 400.10113 Employee records
(1) Employee records shall be maintained for each
employee and shall
include all of the following information: (d) Three
references which are obtained before employment
from persons unrelated

to the employee.
I reviewed seven new staff files. Seven out of seven staff files did not have
references documented prior to hire date.
COF Rule 400.10211 Resident release report
(1)When a resident is released from a detention or
shelter care facility, all of the following shall be
documented: (b) The new location of the resident, if
known.
Eight residential files were reviewed. One out of eight did not have the new
location of the resident documented.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical Assistance was given in the area of program statement. Court may
need to detain youth for periods of time to tether youth. Also walked through
rules that would need to be followed in order to be in compliance.
• Discussed CAP.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was provided in CAP writing.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance

The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
Agency is in compliance.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Agency is in compliance.
Chief Administrator Assessment
Agency is in compliance,
Staff and Youth Interviews
All staff interviewed provided positive feedback. All reported that there are
changes occurring in getting ready for the move to the new building. All reported
there is an influx in restraints this year, due to new staff, new programming, and
receiving youth from Juvenile Detention Center in Wayne County.
Youth reported they are well taken care of at the facility. All reported they are
respected and receive all basic needs.
Description of Agency Walk Through
Agency is well maintained. Within the next year the operations will be moved next
door to the new construction.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
